history.proof: intros X P. unfold characteristic_function_to_ensemble. shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment X : Type P : X -> Prop Unable to unify "P" with "characteristic_function_abstraction (fun x : X => P x)".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), [x : X | P x] = P

Premises:
characteristic_function_to_ensemble = fun (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) => characteristic_function_abstraction P : forall X : Type, (X -> Prop) -> Ensemble X Arguments characteristic_function_to_ensemble {X}%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive characteristic_function_abstraction (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (x : X) : Prop := intro_characteristic_sat : P x -> In (characteristic_function_abstraction P) x Arguments characteristic_function_abstraction {X}%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments intro_characteristic_sat {X}%type_scope _%function_scope
Inhabited_ind : forall (U : Type) (B : Ensemble U) (P : Prop), (forall x : U, In B x -> P) -> Inhabited B -> P
BinPos.Pos.SubMaskSpec_ind : forall (p q : BinNums.positive) (P : BinPos.Pos.mask -> Prop), (p = q -> P BinPos.Pos.IsNul) -> (forall r : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.add q r = p -> P (BinPos.Pos.IsPos r)) -> (forall r : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.add p r = q -> P BinPos.Pos.IsNeg) -> forall m : BinPos.Pos.mask, BinPos.Pos.SubMaskSpec p q m -> P m
Union_ind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> Prop), (forall x : U, In B x -> P x) -> (forall x : U, In C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Union B C u -> P u
Intersection_ind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> Prop), (forall x : U, In B x -> In C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Intersection B C u -> P u
EqdepFacts.Streicher_K_ = fun U : Type => forall (x : U) (P : x = x -> Prop), EqdepFacts.Streicher_K_on_ U x P : Type -> Prop Arguments EqdepFacts.Streicher_K_ _%type_scope
Disjoint_ind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : Prop), ((forall x : U, ~ In (Intersection B C) x) -> P) -> Disjoint B C -> P
Fin.case0 : forall (P : Fin.t 0 -> Type) (p : Fin.t 0), P p
Eqdep_dec.eq_dep_eq_dec : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> forall (P : A -> Type) (p : A) (x y : P p), EqdepFacts.eq_dep A P p x p y -> x = y
Union_sind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> SProp), (forall x : U, In B x -> P x) -> (forall x : U, In C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Union B C u -> P u
Inductive reflect (P : Prop) : bool -> Set := ReflectT : P -> Bool.reflect P true | ReflectF : ~ P -> Bool.reflect P false Arguments Bool.reflect _%type_scope _%bool_scope Arguments Bool.ReflectT _%type_scope Arguments Bool.ReflectF _%type_scope
Intersection_sind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> SProp), (forall x : U, In B x -> In C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Intersection B C u -> P u
Inhabited_sind : forall (U : Type) (B : Ensemble U) (P : SProp), (forall x : U, In B x -> P) -> Inhabited B -> P
BinNums.positive_ind : forall P : BinNums.positive -> Prop, (forall p : BinNums.positive, P p -> P (BinNums.xI p)) -> (forall p : BinNums.positive, P p -> P (BinNums.xO p)) -> P BinNums.xH -> forall p : BinNums.positive, P p
Bool.ReflectT : forall P : Prop, P -> Bool.reflect P true
Disjoint_rec : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : Set), ((forall x : U, ~ In (Intersection B C) x) -> P) -> Disjoint B C -> P
Disjoint_sind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : SProp), ((forall x : U, ~ In (Intersection B C) x) -> P) -> Disjoint B C -> P
Disjoint_rect : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : Type), ((forall x : U, ~ In (Intersection B C) x) -> P) -> Disjoint B C -> P
Bool.ReflectF : forall P : Prop, ~ P -> Bool.reflect P false
Fin.t_ind : forall P : forall n : nat, Fin.t n -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P (S n) Fin.F1) -> (forall (n : nat) (t : Fin.t n), P n t -> P (S n) (Fin.FS t)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : Fin.t n), P n t
Fin.caseS : forall P : forall n : nat, Fin.t (S n) -> Type, (forall n : nat, P n Fin.F1) -> (forall (n : nat) (p : Fin.t n), P n (Fin.FS p)) -> forall (n : nat) (p : Fin.t (S n)), P n p
ssrbool.prop_in1 : forall T1 : Type, ssrbool.mem_pred T1 -> forall P : T1 -> Prop, ssreflect.phantom Prop (forall x : T1, P x) -> Prop
VectorDef.rect2 : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n -> VectorDef.t ?B n -> Type, P 0 (VectorDef.nil ?A) (VectorDef.nil ?B) -> (forall (n : nat) (v1 : VectorDef.t ?A n) (v2 : VectorDef.t ?B n), P n v1 v2 -> forall (a : ?A) (b : ?B), P (S n) (VectorDef.cons ?A a n v1) (VectorDef.cons ?B b n v2)) -> forall (n : nat) (v1 : VectorDef.t ?A n) (v2 : VectorDef.t ?B n), P n v1 v2 where ?A : [ |- Type] ?B : [ |- Type]
VectorDef.caseS : forall P : forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A (S n) -> Type, (forall (h : ?A) (n : nat) (t : VectorDef.t ?A n), P n (VectorDef.cons ?A h n t)) -> forall (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t ?A (S n)), P n v where ?A : [ |- Type]
EqdepFacts.Streicher_K_on_ : forall (U : Type) (x : U), (x = x -> Prop) -> Prop
Eqdep.Eq_rect_eq.eq_rect_eq : forall (U : Type) (p : U) (Q : U -> Type) (x : Q p) (h : p = p), x = eq_rect p Q x p h
List.ext_in_map : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), List.map f l = List.map g l -> forall a : A, List.In a l -> f a = g a
Eqdep.EqdepTheory.eq_rec_eq : forall (U : Type) (p : U) (Q : U -> Set) (x : Q p) (h : p = p), x = eq_rec p Q x p h
In = fun (U : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (x : U) => A x : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> U -> Prop Arguments In {U}%type_scope
Included = fun (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) => forall x : U, In B x -> In C x : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U -> Prop Arguments Included {U}%type_scope
ssrbool.in_mem = fun (T : Type) (x : T) (mp : ssrbool.mem_pred T) => ssrbool.pred_of_mem mp x : forall T : Type, T -> ssrbool.mem_pred T -> bool Arguments ssrbool.in_mem {T}%type_scope : simpl never
Inductive SubMaskSpec (p q : BinNums.positive) : BinPos.Pos.mask -> Prop := SubIsNul : p = q -> BinPos.Pos.SubMaskSpec p q BinPos.Pos.IsNul | SubIsPos : forall r : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.add q r = p -> BinPos.Pos.SubMaskSpec p q (BinPos.Pos.IsPos r) | SubIsNeg : forall r : BinNums.positive, BinPos.Pos.add p r = q -> BinPos.Pos.SubMaskSpec p q BinPos.Pos.IsNeg Arguments BinPos.Pos.SubMaskSpec (_ _)%positive_scope Arguments BinPos.Pos.SubIsNul (_ _)%positive_scope Arguments BinPos.Pos.SubIsPos (_ _ _)%positive_scope Arguments BinPos.Pos.SubIsNeg (_ _ _)%positive_scope
Add = fun (U : Type) (B : Ensemble U) (x : U) => Union B (Singleton x) : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> U -> Ensemble U Arguments Add {U}%type_scope
Subtract = fun (U : Type) (B : Ensemble U) (x : U) => Setminus B (Singleton x) : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> U -> Ensemble U Arguments Subtract {U}%type_scope
ssreflect.unlocked : forall (T : Type) (v : T), ssreflect.unlockable v -> T
VectorSpec.shiftin_nth : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (n : nat) (v : VectorDef.t A n) (k1 k2 : Fin.t n), k1 = k2 -> VectorDef.nth (VectorDef.shiftin a v) (Fin.L_R 1 k1) = VectorDef.nth v k2
ssreflect.unlock : forall (T : Type) (x : T) (C : ssreflect.unlockable x), ssreflect.unlocked C = x
Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : VectorDef.t A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A (S n) Arguments VectorDef.t _%type_scope _%nat_scope Arguments VectorDef.nil _%type_scope Arguments VectorDef.cons _%type_scope _ _%nat_scope
Complement = fun (U : Type) (A : Ensemble U) (x : U) => ~ In A x : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U Arguments Complement {U}%type_scope

original: intros X P. unfold characteristic_function_to_ensemble. reflexivity.
